Name: ArtistShare
Notes: Has own record label.

Name: Bountysource
Notes: Bounties are attached to GitHub issues. Anyone can collect the bounty by submitting a pull request that resolves the issue.

Name: CentUp
Notes: Decentralized crowdfunding linked to specific pieces of content.

Name: ClassWish
Focus: Education crowdfunding for school and teacher supplies
Notes: Allows tax-deductible support of any school and any teacher in the U.S.

Name: CommonBond
Notes: Funded by crowdsourcing and large investors.

Name: Community Funded
Focus: Platform Creation for Universities, Nonprofits, and Faith-Based Organizations
Notes: Allows for white-labeled integration on existing websites

Name: Experiment.com
Notes: No tangible awards are given for backing, only personal satisfaction. Formerly called Microryza.

Name: FundAnything
Focus: Funding for any kind of project - business, creative, arts, personal, charitable.
Notes: Fundraising backed by major celebrities such as Donald Trump.

Name: FundedByMe
Country: Sweden, Finland, Norway, Italy, Germany, Denmark
Notes: Only platform offering equity and reward based crowdfunding in combination with European-wide cross-border investments.

Name: FundRazr
Focus: Personal, charitable, entrepreneurial, creative, and political causes
Notes: Lets you embed your campaign on Facebook, blog or website using easy to use Widgets. Offers Live Chat and Personal Coaching.

Name: Fundly
Notes: Available as an app for a Facebook page. Charges a per credit card transaction fee.

Name: GiveForward
Focus: Online fundraising website to raise money for medical expenses.
Notes: Provides personal fundraising coaches.

Name: GlobalGiving
Focus: Nonprofit fundraising for registered organizations in 160+ countries
Notes: Provides 501c3 equivalency for non-US organizations

Name: GoFundMe
Focus:
Helping people after
accidents and illnesses
Notes: Provides 5-minute customer email support.

Name: Indiegogo
Focus: Allows a broad range of projects

Name: JustGiving
Notes: Facilitates charity and individual crowdfunding.

Name: Kickstarter
Country: US, UK, Canada, Australia, New Zealand
Notes: Highest funded projects to date

Name: Lighthouse
Notes: Decentralized and free to use. No intermediaries (zero fees). Uses bitcoin (cryptocurrency).

Name: Myfreeimplants
Notes: Focused on breast augmentations. International

Name: Offbeatr
Notes: Projects must first get enough votes from users before they are open for funding

Name: Peoplefund.it
Notes: Attached to Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall

Name: Piggybackr
Notes: Young students may raise money.  Compliant with  Children's Online Privacy Protection Act

Name: Planeta.ru
Focus: Allows a broad range of projects

Name: Pozible
Notes: Bitcoin can be used, Self-hosting can be used, One-on-One help

Name: Rally.org
Focus: Medical, educational, charitable, creative, entrepreneurial, and political causes

Name: Tilt.com
Notes: Offers both a consumer product and enterprise solution for brands.

Name: YouCaring
Focus: Medical expenses, memorials and other personal and charitable causes
Notes: Does not charge any fees, other than payment processing

Name: Weeve
Notes: Site operates "freemium" model without transaction fees

Notes: Notes

Focus: SMEs in emerging and frontier markets

Name: MicroVentures

Name: SecondMarket

Name: TrustLeaf

Name: Unbound
Notes: Acts as both a crowdfunding platform and a publisher.  Launched Terry Jones' Evil Machines, the first book to be financed by crowd funding.

Name: Patreon
Funding model: Every time new content is released
Country: Subscribing to a project allows to view and post on its content stream. Patreon allows to set a monthly maximum to avoid going over a set budget.

Name: Subbable
Country: The money that users spend goes into a "perk bank" and can be redeemed for creator-determined perks. Free subscriptions are available.

Name: Flattr
Funding model: Flattr button display along the content
